verses.verse: Then Joseph<WH3130> couldn't<WH3201> control<WH662> himself before all those who stood<WH5324> before him,<WH7121> and he cried, "Cause<WH3318> everyone<WH376> to go out<WH3318> from me!<WH376>" No one else stood<WH5975> with him,<WH3130> while Joseph made himself known<WH3045> to his brothers.<WH251>
He wept<WH6963> aloud.<WH5414> The Egyptians<WH4714> heard,<WH1004> and the house of Pharaoh<WH6547> heard.<WH8085>

Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> "I am Joseph!<WH3130> Does my father<WH1> still live?<WH2416>" His brothers<WH251> couldn't<WH3201> answer<WH6030> him;<WH926> for they were terrified at his presence.<WH6440>

Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> "Come near<WH5066> to me,<WH5066> please." They came near. "He said,<WH559> I am Joseph,<WH3130> your brother,<WH251> whom you sold<WH4376> into Egypt.<WH4714>
Now don't<WH6087> be grieved, nor angry<WH2734> with yourselves,<WH5869> that you sold<WH4376> me here,<WH430> for God sent<WH7971> me before you<WH6440> to preserve life.<WH4241>

For these two years<WH8141> the famine<WH7458> has been in<WH7130> the land,<WH776> and there are yet five<WH2568> years,<WH8141> in which there will be neither<WH369> plowing<WH2758> nor harvest.<WH7105>
God<WH430> sent<WH7971> me before you<WH6440> to preserve<WH7760> for you<WH6440> a remnant in the earth,<WH776> and to save you alive<WH2421> by a great<WH1419> deliverance.<WH6413>

So now it wasn't<WH7971> you who sent me here,<WH430> but God, and he has made<WH7760> me a father<WH1> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> lord<WH113> of all his house,<WH1004> and ruler<WH4910> over all the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

Hurry,<WH4116> and go up<WH5927> to my father,<WH1> and tell<WH559> him,<WH1121> 'This is what your son Joseph<WH3130> says,<WH559> "God<WH430> has made<WH7760> me lord<WH113> of all Egypt.<WH4714> Come down<WH3381> to me.<WH5975> Don't wait.

You shall dwell<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Goshen,<WH1657> and you will be near<WH7138> to me,<WH1121> you, your children, your children<WH1121>'s children,<WH1121> your flocks,<WH6629> your herds,<WH1241> and all that you have.
There I will nourish<WH3557> you;<WH2568> for there are yet five years<WH8141> of famine;<WH7458> lest you come to poverty,<WH3423> you,<WH1004> and your household, and all that you have."'
Behold,<WH5869> your eyes see,<WH7200> and the eyes<WH5869> of my brother<WH251> Benjamin,<WH1144> that it is my mouth<WH6310> that speaks to you.<WH1696>
You shall tell<WH5046> my father<WH1> of all my glory<WH3519> in Egypt,<WH4714> and of all that you have seen.<WH7200> You shall hurry<WH4116> and bring my father<WH1> down here.<WH3381>"
He fell<WH5307> on his brother<WH251> Benjamin<WH1144>'s neck,<WH6677> and wept,<WH1058> and Benjamin<WH1144> wept<WH1058> on his neck.<WH6677>
He kissed<WH5401> all his brothers,<WH251> and wept<WH1058> on them.<WH310> After that his brothers<WH251> talked with him.<WH1696>

The report<WH6963> of it was heard<WH8085> in Pharaoh<WH6547>'s house,<WH1004> saying,<WH559> "Joseph<WH3130>'s brothers<WH251> have come.<WH935>" It pleased<WH5869> Pharaoh<WH6547> well,<WH3190> and<WH5869> his servants.<WH5650>

Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "Tell<WH559> your brothers,<WH251> <WH6213> 'Do this.<WH2943> Load your animals,<WH1165> and go,<WH3212> travel<WH935> to the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>

Take<WH3947> your father<WH1> and your households,<WH1004> and come<WH935> to me,<WH5414> and I will give you the good<WH2898> of the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and you will eat<WH398> the fat<WH2459> of the land.<WH776>'

Now you are commanded:<WH6680> do<WH6213> this.<WH3947> Take wagons<WH5699> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> for your little ones,<WH2945> and for your wives,<WH802> and bring<WH5375> your father,<WH1> and come.<WH935>
Also,<WH5869> don't<WH2347> concern yourselves about your belongings,<WH3627> for the good<WH2898> of all of the land<WH776> of Egypt is yours.<WH4714>"

The sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> so.<WH3130> Joseph gave<WH5414> them wagons,<WH5699> according to the commandment<WH6310> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and gave<WH5414> them provision<WH6720> for the way.<WH1870>

He gave<WH5414> each one of them<WH376> changes<WH2487> of clothing,<WH8071> but to Benjamin<WH1144> he gave<WH5414> three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> pieces of silver<WH3701> and five<WH2568> changes<WH2487> of clothing.<WH8071>

He sent<WH7971> the following<WH2063> to his father:<WH1> ten<WH6235> donkeys<WH860> loaded<WH5375> with the good things<WH2898> of Egypt,<WH4714> and ten<WH6235> female donkeys<WH2543> loaded<WH5375> with grain<WH1250> and bread<WH3899> and provision<WH4202> for his father<WH1> by the way.<WH1870>
So he sent<WH7971> his brothers<WH251> away,<WH7971> and they departed.<WH3212> He said<WH559> to them,<WH7264> "See that you don't quarrel on the way.<WH1870>"
They went up<WH5927> out of Egypt,<WH4714> and came<WH935> into the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> to Jacob<WH3290> their father.<WH1>

They told<WH5046> him,<WH559> saying, "Joseph<WH3130> is still alive,<WH2416> and he is ruler<WH4910> over all the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>" His heart<WH3820> fainted,<WH6313> for he didn't<WH539> believe them.

They told<WH1696> him all the words<WH1697> of Joseph,<WH3130> which he had said<WH1696> to them.<WH7200> When he saw the wagons<WH5699> which Joseph<WH3130> had sent<WH7971> to carry<WH5375> him,<WH7307> the spirit of Jacob,<WH3290> their father,<WH1> revived.<WH2421>
Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> "It is enough.<WH7227> Joseph<WH3130> my son<WH1121> is still alive.<WH2416> I will go<WH3212> and see him<WH7200> before I die.<WH4191>"
